org.thymeleaf.text

Interface ITextRepository

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LimitedSizeCacheTextRepository, NoCacheTextRepository

    public interface ITextRepository

    Common interface for repositories of text (String) instances created by the parser or document model.

    Implementations of this interface must be thread-safe.

    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Daniel Fernández

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getText(char[] text, int offset, int len)
      Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument.
      String getText(CharSequence text)
      Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument.
      String getText(CharSequence text0, CharSequence text1)
      Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument (composed of more than one fragment).
      String getText(CharSequence text0, CharSequence text1, CharSequence text2)
      Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument (composed of more than one fragment).
      String getText(CharSequence text0, CharSequence text1, CharSequence text2, CharSequence text3)
      Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument (composed of more than one fragment).
      String getText(CharSequence text0, CharSequence text1, CharSequence text2, CharSequence text3, CharSequence text4)
      Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument (composed of more than one fragment).
      String getText(CharSequence text, int beginIndex, int endIndex)
      Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument, which is a subsequence of the CharSequence object starting in index beginIndex (inclusive) until index endIndex (exclusive).

    • Method Detail

      • getText

        String getText(CharSequence text)

        Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument.

        Parameters:
        text - the text to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the stored text.

      • getText

        String getText(CharSequence text,
               int beginIndex,
               int endIndex)

        Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument, which is a subsequence of the CharSequence object starting in index beginIndex (inclusive) until index endIndex (exclusive).

        Parameters:
        text - the text to be retrieved.
        beginIndex - the starting index (inclusive).
        endIndex - the end index (exclusive).
        Returns:
        the stored text.

      • getText

        String getText(CharSequence text0,
               CharSequence text1)

        Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument (composed of more than one fragment).

        The aim of this method is to avoid the need to create instances of appended String or CharSequence objects, using the repository to find the unique version of the appended result.

        Parameters:
        text0 - the first fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text1 - the second fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the stored text.

      • getText

        String getText(CharSequence text0,
               CharSequence text1,
               CharSequence text2)

        Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument (composed of more than one fragment).

        The aim of this method is to avoid the need to create instances of appended String or CharSequence objects, using the repository to find the unique version of the appended result.

        Parameters:
        text0 - the first fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text1 - the second fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text2 - the third fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the stored text.

      • getText

        String getText(CharSequence text0,
               CharSequence text1,
               CharSequence text2,
               CharSequence text3)

        Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument (composed of more than one fragment).

        The aim of this method is to avoid the need to create instances of appended String or CharSequence objects, using the repository to find the unique version of the appended result.

        Parameters:
        text0 - the first fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text1 - the second fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text2 - the third fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text3 - the fourth fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the stored text.

      • getText

        String getText(CharSequence text0,
               CharSequence text1,
               CharSequence text2,
               CharSequence text3,
               CharSequence text4)

        Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument (composed of more than one fragment).

        The aim of this method is to avoid the need to create instances of appended String or CharSequence objects, using the repository to find the unique version of the appended result.

        Parameters:
        text0 - the first fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text1 - the second fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text2 - the third fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text3 - the fourth fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        text4 - the fifth fragment of the text to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the stored text.

      • getText

        String getText(char[] text,
               int offset,
               int len)

        Retrieve the stored version of the text passed as argument.

        Parameters:
        text - the buffer containing the text to be retrieved.
        offset - tbe offset to be aplied to the text buffer.
        len - the length of the text in the specified buffer.
        Returns:
        the stored text.
